A4.text: The feast was introduced in Constantinople in 379.

A5.text: December 25 was the traditional date of the winter solstice in the Roman Empire, where most Christians lived, and the Roman festival Dies Natalis Solis Invicti had been held on this date since 274 AD.

A6.text: in Antioch by John Chrysostom towards the end of the fourth century, probably in 388
